item.title: Use your phone less by using grayscale mode
item.description: By changing the colors on your phone's display to shades of gray, your phone will become less visually appealing and can help reduce your temptation to use it.

item.author: (Jeroen Mols)

item.title: How I Deal With Carpal Tunnel Syndrome as a Software Developer
item.description: Warning: This blog post is not sponsored by Logitech! Although it would be nice if it was, wink wink ;) My wrists got their share from spending hours writing code every day. At the end of every night, I would feel pain in my elbow and a tingling sensation in my fingers. These are common symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome! So I started stretching to ease the constant pressure on my nerves.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Has Never Done Anything Original and I Can Prove It · Notes
item.description: Young, billionaire, CEO and owner of majority voting power of a global company that owns apps and social networks used by billions of people every day. I am talking, of course, about Mark Zuckerberg. Those who read this resume and know Zuck&amp;rsquo;s story might imagine a modern, digital version of the great inventors of the past. A creative, innovative brain, a living legend among us. The Einstein of this generation, the Nicolaus Copernicus of the 21st century who saw before everyone else that our lives would revolve around connected screens.
item.author: (by Rodrigo Ghedin)

item.title: Software complexity and potential solutions
item.description: I started my morning off with Alan Kay's talk Programming and Scaling. There are several things I agree with and disagree with in that talk. It got me thinking about software as a whole, and my part to play in it.
item.author: (By Macoy Madson. Published on December 16, 2022.)
